intro: Vigna vexillata f. typica, commonly known as the cowpea or black-eyed bean, is a leguminous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is characterized by its erect growth habit, trifoliate leaves, and distinctive pods that contain edible seeds. The plant is well adapted to warm climates and can thrive in poor soil conditions. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, and it is known for its ability to fix atmospheric nitrogen, improving soil fertility. Vigna vexillata f. typica is widely cultivated for its nutritional seeds, which are rich in protein and used in various cuisines around the world.
